text: The worker Paul  at this location lied about a free month when he overheard me and my sister talking about taking our things to another storage facility because they have a 1 month free promotion and he says so do we now fast forward a month later and I have late fees and liens in my property because he lied. You can never get anyone on the phone no matter what time of day it is. Also I have called corporate several times spoke with someone named David Reed who was very short and nasty because he kept saying you have to call the store and speak with them when I explained that no one is on the office when I get off at 6. Even though I was told they are there until 7. So I was told on Thursday that he would call me back by 1:00 that day to discuss this (remind you this is the guy who lied to me.) Still haven't spoke with the manager at this facility and I thinks it's because they know they messed up. So for 3 weeks I have been given the run around and still no district manager or nothing. I will say this how ever it turn out from thus point I WILL NOT NOR WILL I RECOMMEND THIS UHAUL COMPANY TO ANYONE! Now the lie is it's only if you are moving one way (BUT WHO MOVES OUT OF STATE AND PUT THERE THINGS IN A STORAGE IT MAKES NO DENSE AT ALL!!!!!) Save your time and money and go to another place. The manager at the location up the street is worse his name is Antonio. Don't know why any of these people got into customer service cause clearly they are not cut out for this job. They say you pay for what you get so buyer beware this is what I got lesson learned that's for sure!!!!!!!

name: Remain Nameless
text: Ward.... you were a little hard on the Beaver. The worst place in Oxford is on the south side of Hwy 78 East. The BEST place is A&B and they are located on the north side of 78 just east of Hutch Touch. I'm in retail sales in the trailer industry myself and A & B Trailers is my go to source for information, parts, and trailers. If  I have a question about ANYTHING in regards to dragging a wagon... A&B Trailers.. Knowledge level? I'll put it this way; theres not anything they can't  cover on your trailer.  I promise, they will never lead you wrong. These guys are not pencil pushers that have sit behind a desk all of their lives. They are blue collar, hard working, hands on, highly experienced fabricators and they know their stuff. If you want to spend half of your retirement on junk just to have it fall apart in a few months, then go across the street and shop with Ward. Now if you want an extremely well built, solid piece of equipment at a reasonable price  from an excellent company that stands behind their product AND appreciates their customers?... Welcome home family!! You are in the right place. A&B Trailers. You won't find better people anywhere and let me just add this in there.... these cats are Perfectionists. I know. I have worked side by side with them in a fab shop and I am a perfectionist also, but these jokers....well they take it to a whole nother other level. I will take an oath to say, "They do things at A&B with a whole bunch of heart and a truck load of pride. It's done once, done right, and that's the product they will provide you every single time. I highly recommend A&B Trailers for all of your parts, accessories,  tires, wheels, batteries, or even if you are looking to upgrade with a brand new piece of pride attached to your vehicle.. Come on down to A&B. I'm sure glad I stopped here. Received a solid product and made two friends for life. Where else can you get service like that? A&B Trailers. Ask for Andy or Barney. NO need in referencing my review. They'll know who sent ya when you call them by their names 🤣

text: Worst customer service I have ever seen anywhere.  Had a scheduled appointment with them to install a hitch at 9:00. This was the first available spot two weeks ago. Did arrive 30 min late. Girl at counter was nice and said it would be ready in approximately 1.5 hours. Left it for 2.5 hours and came back. Car has not been touched. I drove an hour to get there and an hour home. Wrecked half a day. Asked for a full refund. Asked for the manger and he yelled at me, saying “we call you when ready”. I asked was it complete and he yelled “does it have a hitch on it?”  He didn’t know or care and walked outside to see. I asked for the contact info of his manager. I called him and all he said was we let you down and I will talk to manager. They should have put the car on the rack, and knocked it out and offered some sort of discount. I leave on vacation tomorrow so no hitch, no trailering. I wouldn’t spend a dime here ever again, and it’s no wonder there rating is so low here and on y e l p.

name: Kristyn Taylor
text: These guys are great! I'm always leery of the auto parts place when I'm alone, since I'm a woman and I know some places try to take advantage.  The nice man at Napa listened to the tale of my sketchy car and decided to just test my battery.  When he found that the cable things were loose, but my battery was fine, he tightened them for me and just told me to come back tomorrow if that didn't help.  No Talking down to me or trying to sell me anything.  Perfect experience!

name: Charles Nolan
text: My daughter had a terrible shaking in her steering. Her boss suggested Automasters due to good experiences he has had there. They told her the tire she was driving on was dangerous because it had developed a bulge. They also told her she needed new rear brakes. I'm sure most of you are like me tired of being ripped by dishonest repair places. Well, to my surprise this place was honest, they told her exactly what was wrong, and fixed it right, and they gave me a reasonable price.  I highly recommend Automasters for that reason. Just give them a call, talk to them, I think you will agree. I'm so glad we have the ability to review places now. It feels great to get one that does you wrong, but feels even better to help a company who chooses to treat you right. Thanks to Brooks and the whole gang for taking care of my daughter. I will be back!

name: David Allain
text:
Started my journey with renting a UHAUL truck and trailer two weeks before the move. Megan was very knowledgeable and helped me make the right truck size choice. Unfortunately, the uhaul reservation system was down that day so I reserved from home later that week.

For some reason the “traffic” division of UHAUL that is not based in Auburn changed my reservation the day before and I was going to have to go to Phoenix City to pick up a truck, and Opelika to pick up the trailer. Ended up working with Hunter King and Hugh three times in one day, the day before the rental pickup date, to iron out my issues.

Hunter gave the info for traffic try and get it sorted out, which eventually did work. There wasn’t anything he could do to add my reservation to the store because they were out of truck. By an act of God someone canceled later and I got the truck I needed at this location. Then “traffic” moved it again..

Needless to say. Hunter K. was knowledgeable, patient, and extremely helpful in getting the reservation squared away again and even helped add an extra day to my reservation so I could get the truck immediately.

11/10 recommend this store because of the employees Megan, Hunter K., and Hugh.

I say everything here to show you how much of a hassle it can be to reserve online. If you can reserve in-person at this store it will save SOOO many headaches.

War Damn Eagle

name: Laurie Hillanbrand
text: A No Show. We made a reservation for a Move In date for a Saturday. The woman who took the information said they are no longer open on a Saturday, but she would make the exception for this time. She gave us her personal cell phone number and asked if we would call 15 minutes before arrival and she would meet us to sign the paper work. We did just that, no one picked up, but we left a message. We arrived with a dorm room full of stuff to store for the summer and we called again, no answer. The sign on the door of the office said they were closed but to call the number (her number)AND the national number, which is what we did. The Representative for the national number said the U-HAUL company doesn't allow their storage buildings to close on a Saturday and that they couldn't do more to help us. So while we waited for a return phone call, we started looking at other storage places near by and STOR-EAGLE Storage was able to accommodate us with no problems! At the time of this review it has been almost 5 hours since we left a message at U-HAUL Moving & Storage of Auburn and we still did not get a return phone call. Make a reservation at your own risk.

name: Rachel Sugg
text:
My husband and I chose to use Uhaul for our move because it was the best affordable option. For future moves we will do everything we can to avoid working with them again.

After making a reservation a month in advance, we found that our truck had been double booked and watched it be given to someone else right in front of us. When asked for some kind of alternative or assistance, the man who was supposed to be helping us simply told us, “That’s too bad,” and that we could call the national Uhaul line. Because our state is becoming overwhelmed with COVID-19 cases, we used the Uhaul app to check in and pick up the truck. However, the man helping us said that we should have come inside (where not a single employee was masked) if we wanted the truck. We understand that this situation may not have been this individual’s fault, but his behavior made our situation even more distressing, as he was quite rude, even belligerent, and made no attempt at an apology for this very disruptive mistake.

This mixup has made our lives very difficult, and we were sorely disappointed in the employee’s attitude toward us. In the future, we will not be using Uhaul, and from now on we will be warning others about this.

name: Chelsea Clayton
text: I have rented uhaul trailers before but I have never had an experience like this one! The employees absolutely knocked my socks off!! We waited in the store for 10 mins until

name: James S
text: Unable to complete reservation because "keys were lost by last person to use the van." First, there should be duplicates. Second, I was called the morning I was supposed to move. Why even bother guaranteeing something that is not there? After cancelling my reservation and having me go around town looking for a same-day, 3x more rental, the location did not even tell me about the U-Haul program that gives partial reimbursements for failed guarantees.

name: Paramjit “Perry” Kahai, PhD
text:
The rep who assisted me at this store is a tall, bearded man.  As soon as he handed me the truck, I took a picture of the odometer. On the contract, he had mileage out that was lower than what I saw before I started moving. The mileage out should be the odometer mileage when the truck is handed to the customer, not the mileage that may be on their records when the truck was returned by a previous customer.

Also, unknown to me, there was a dolly in the back that I had not even reserved.  I saw it only when I opened the back to load my stuff.  I was surprised, to say the least and wondered if I will be billed for it. Guess what?  I was billed for it even though I had not used it. And how did he know that I had used it? When I called this morning, he told me that the plastic tab that was attached to the dolly was broken. When I try to assure him that I had not even touched the dolly, his response was rude and something like "we have a lot of customers who say they didn't use the dolly but they actually did." In short, he had just accused me of lying!  My question is: why was the dolly even there in the first place? I had not reserved it!  And if there was something in the back of the truck, he should have opened the back and shown it to me.  I would have asked for the dolly to be taken out. Further, how do I know that tab wasn't broken before the truck keys were handed to me? So, this was a clear case of an attempt to cheat a customer.  I wonder how many people this store rep has cheated.  Next time, if I ever rent again from this location (which I very much doubt) or any other, I will make certain to open the back and have them remove any extra stuff I did not order!

Any attempts at talking with the rep over the phone was met with rude, curt, and insulting responses.  The phone call was recorded by the location, so that will provide evidence of whether I am telling the truth about the rep's attitude and lack of respect towards me.

BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU RENT A TRUCK AT THIS LOCATION. INSPECT EVERYTHING BEFORE YOU LEAVE AND HAVE THEM REMOVE EVERYTHING YOU HAD NOT RESERVED.

name: Shari Belton
text: The General Manager greets you at the door. I had a reservation to pick up a trailer for my son and later found out it wasn't needed. The store was able to refund my money within two days, even though I purchased a one-way rental. Be sure to stop by there for all of your rental needs!

name: John Parker
text: Without a doubt, the most unprofessional outfit of workers I've ever witnessed behind a single desk. My sister went into the store to complete the very routine process of accessing her storage unit. However, unbeknownst to her or anyone else, they were full and instead rerouted her reservation to Georgia. This information was not even gathered until they second attempt to receive help from the desk, for the first time we spoke to their general manager, Tavon Scott, who was at the moment in no mood to do his job. As soon as he saw that our last name did not come up in the computer, he looked at us as if we were crazy and then proceeded to profusely rid himself of all blame ("it was the call center") and yelled at us for becoming frustrated at the fact that we seemingly had no storage. He was completely unwilling to make up for the fault of his company in any capacity and did nothing but sit there and act annoyed at our frustration. I dropped by one last time to use the restroom and I could hear them quoting us and laughing at our situation until they saw I had come in. I was so disgusted at their attitude about their job that I marched up to the desk to get Mr. Scott's full name to write in this report, to which he replied, laughing "You can just look up my name if you need it." I replied "take care" and he replied "oh I will take care" and continued to murmur something under his breath to the amusement of his coworkers. I've never held an official job to this date, but if I talked half as rudely to any customer as they did to us, I'd expect to be canned on the spot, and that's exactly what I wish upon this man, Mr. Scott. I'd equate this crew to a group of shiftless, gawky teenagers who are too immature to own up to their own shortcomings. Simply put, these insolent fools don't know how to represent a company and don't appreciate the name stitched onto their shirt. They've made a decision to be bad at what they do. One star for knowing English.

name: Mark Gallagher
text: My reserved trailer was rented to another person which sent it over 90 miles away.   However, since we all remained calm; they worked with us and gave us a 17 foot truck which worked out so much better than a small trailer.  It had better gas milage, great air conditioning, and we didn't need to pay extra for a logistical error.  Thanks guys at Auburn U-Haul for making my move stress free and helping out even though you really didn't need to....

name: Christopher Abreu
text: I had reserved a truck a month in advance, only to have it redirected from this location to another 45 minutes away the day before my move. They claim they were “overbooked”, even though they confirmed the reservation to me over the phone earlier in the week, and was not updated online until after the email. Calling the office takes you to their call center, where you either get someone that is willing to help or someone that hangs up on you. I would not recommend bringing your business here, as the overall experience was unprofessional, sloppy, and infuriating.

name: Whitney Mullins
text: I reserved a self-storage climate control unit with U-Haul on February 1st. I kept the email confirmation and went by to make sure everything was in order so my roommate could begin moving their stuff into storage. After twenty minutes of waiting in line I showed them the email and asked how to go about getting access to the unit since I had never done this before. The man looked up everything and said I was nowhere in the system. I showed him the confirmation and everything that was needed and he said he was sorry, but there was nothing he could do. The manager came out and said that they have not had the climate control storage for over two months now. I told him I have had the unit reserved since February and received no notice that anything was changed. I even called two days ago checking to make sure and the lady said everything was fine. I asked them if they could help me out because I had to find somewhere to put the items because I have to be moved out by noon tomorrow and cannot move into my new place until August 15. They said they could not help me and turned me away. I will never use the company of U-Haul again. There was only one storage unit available in the city of Auburn, and it was at Uncle Bob's storage. The only reason they had it available was because someone cancelled an hour before I called. Thank goodness for that.

name: Randy Mauldin
text:
I rented a 26' truck today. You double billed my credit card. I should have known that you were a disreputable business when Michael asked me for my credit card without quoting me a price. Since you are a monopoly I guess you think that people will pay any amount of money to rent a truck.
He then quoted me a price which I agreed to. I found out when I picked up the truck that he conveniently failed to tell me that there is a hidden fee of $0.99 a mile. WOW, now you have added $80 in hidden fees.
I started to cancel the reservation but then I remembered that you are the only place that rents moving equipment. I had to move so I was stuck with the extortion.
Since you are greedy bastards, you decide to go ahead and stick it to me. You double billed my credit card to make up for the frustration of dealing with an unhappy customer.
Rest assured that this isn't the end of the case. I will contact my credit card company and I will make sure that all of the milage charge is reversed as well as the double billing. When you quote a price, you must honor it.

They also told me that it would take an hour, but the service rep on phone said 4 hours and would be $210.00 plus parts and wire.   Called CTU(CUSTOM TRUCKS UNLIMITED) RIGHT up the street and they install for $125.00 parts and all.  Never ever using these morons again. text: My son got his car battery cheaper than other parts stores. Service was good plus gave my son a NAPA hat but using Chase Elliot from NASCAR which is his favorite driver.

name: James Klentz
text: The salesman greeted me promptly said hello he smiled and asked me what he could do to help me. I mentioned that I had called about a battery for my 92 Toyota Paseo. The salesman looked on the shelves on the floor and then said politely that he would have to search for the battery in the back stockroom. He promptly returned from the back of the store with the battery and completed the transaction. The salesman even helped carry the new battery to my vehicle. I am a fan of Chase Elliott in NASCAR. As I was about to leave the salesman said to wait a minute and walked back into the store. A few minutes later the salesman came back out of the store and hands me a NAPA Racing hat with Chase Elliott's number on it and a replica of his autograph also. I asked him how much I owed for the hat and he said that I didn't owe anything for it since I was a fan of Chase Elliott. I will be using Dutton Auto Parts i.e. Napa for all of my auto parts needs in the near future.

name: Zach Lott
text: Phenomenal customer service by Chris Wallace.  Brought my trailer in that I bought from another dealer because the tail and running lights and one interior light were not working. He quickly determined it was a blown fuse for the tail and running lights and helped me repair the interior light on the spot without charging me. I was expecting to have to drop off the trailer to get it fixed. I was in and out in 30 minutes. It  was awesome to have someone make life a lot easier that day. Can't recommend Chris and Trailer World Alabama enough. To put it simply, he is one solid dude and sincerely wants to take care of customers! Every business could use a guy of his caliber! Thanks again Chris for the help; you're the man!

name: Frankie Sutton
text: After having my trailer for 2 weeks they managed to change one brake assembly. I picked up trailer today after them telling me it could be monday or so before they could finish it. Brought trailer home to install other brake assembly and brakes still not working. After I finally got brakes working correctly on the assmbly I installed, I removed hub that they installed on the same side on the rear tandem. When removing the hub I removed the hub nuts with my hand, they werent even tight. After removing hub and inspecting it noticed that the new seal they had installed was goulded and the spindle was also goulded. Have to replace seal again on the new one they just installed. Have had issues with brakes from the day i purchased trailer. I run hotshot loads and cant afford to be down as long as they had my trailer and still have to go behind them to replace stuff. I have replaced the seals on this trailer twice now and replaced 2 magnets on the brakes with no warranty applied. As for as purchasing trailer I could not ask for better service, but maintenance and offering warranty coverage for parts, there has not been any mention of it other than the brake assemblies.

text: My daughters car wouldn't start and she asked them if they could do a diagnostic and the man working there said no. He believed it was the antitheft system malfunctioning. We bought parts there and still he wouldn't run the diagnostic test for us. He was practically laughing at my teenage daughter the whole time she struggled in the cold. We will never use this business and always use auto zone every time.

name: Adam Benson
text: To bree k. On your story about what took place. The vehicle in question was brought in because the ignition switch was defective. Due to the connector going to the anti-theft module was not making connection. After I spent 30 minutes on the phone with the chevy dealer I found the connector was not available. I instructed your daughter to go and get a complete unit with a new pig tail. After explaining to them that a code reading would bring no results to identify the issue. I did allow the vehicle to sit in my parking lot until the problem could be addressed. Most places charge several hundred dollars to do this. Several days later they brought in a switch from a junk yard that was ripped out and badly damaged. I told them they could not use part due to being damaged. After a couple days a night time worker offered to help with diagnostics, he brought his scan tool and tried to diagnosis the issue. Found the anti-theft module was not making any connection with the vehicles pcm. He spent over an hour trying to help your daughter for free. He normally charges $70 an hour for this. We have gone out of our way to help your daughter every way we could. Including letting the vehicle sit for over a week. No way did your stand out in the cold while we laughed at her. If you feel we miss treated you I am the store manager my name is Adam Benson and feel free to come by and we can discuss this situation.

name: Archduke Bacon Von Cheeseburger
text: Got a Bed liner sprayed in and the bed liner looks great, but the Scratches and chips and gouges in my paint job do not. Update (3-19-18) - When I picked up the truck from commercial van it was very dirty and there were little pieces of bed-liner plastic stuck all over the truck. It looked like over-spray, but they came off when I wiped them, thinking that this wouldn't be a problem I took the truck home (that was my big mistake). I didn't notice the paint chips until after I went home and washed all the little pieces of over-spray plastic off. There are 2 chips next to the drivers side Z71 emblem a gouge in the clear coat right above the drivers side tail light and 2 large chips in the clear coat between the bed and cab on the passengers side. All of these are in the immediate area around where they were working.  I also found a scuff where something rubbery with grit on it was dragged across my passenger rear door and had to use buffing compound to get it off. If you have work done there you need to stay and watch them, because as with any auto shop damage done will never be "their" fault.  Troy the owner called me this morning and asked if I was the one that wrote the bad review of his business. When I told him yes I wrote it he said that review is unnecessary and that I had planned to scam him from the start. When I got tired of listening to his accusations I hung up on him. He then calls me back and leaves a message telling me I was extremely unprofessional and I was no longer welcome at his business. As the owner of a business that relies on good experiences with customers it is HIS job to be the professional. And the professional thing to do would have been to ask me to bring it back so they could look at the damage instead of accusing me of being a scammer. All I was going to ask for was some touch up paint so I could fix it myself, but all I got was hostility and accusations. My father is going to get a bed-liner done on his truck, but he will not be using Commercial Van Specialists in Loxley. Troy and his "business" will never get another dime of my money, nor will they get any business from any of my family and friends.  When I give someone money to work on my vehicle I expect them to treat it and me with respect, but these people fall terribly terribly short.

It took 20 minutes to resolve but she still had given that advise. Ridiculous!

name: Anthony Bunger
text:
Tl;dr I moved from Glen Iris to Hueytown in a few hours and paid $150 for a 15’ truck.Conflicting information from representatives, stressful environment, overpriced. Moving is already stressful, and having to deal with people who want to make things harder is a no-go. I don’t plan on using uhaul again after my experience at this location.

Rented a truck from here on Saturday morning that was due back Sunday at a different location in ensley.

The woman working Saturday morning was helpful, and suggested returning the truck back at the same location because it might be cheaper for us, depending on the mileage and our specific situation.

We were done with the truck early, brought it back that night around 5 to a different uhaul rep (a man). While he was helping us, a different woman uhaul rep told us that we couldn’t return our truck to a different location than on our sheet because it would be more expensive, while the man smirked. Obviously I was confused. I was unable to contact the location that I was supposed to return the truck to (in ensley). When i told her the woman from the morning told us it would be cheaper and insisted she said “okay, charge him! Charge him!” I waited for a long time for her to direct the man in how to check my truck in, And eventually she went out to the vehicle and came back to show me $1,075 charge that would be applied If I returned the vehicle here. So After an hour and a half of run-around, intimidation, and waiting, I left to the place in ensley and returned my truck there, where no one was working (it was 6:20 pm) and left the keys in a box.

name: Lilly Putar
text: Whatever you do, do not hire top of the line moving and labor services to help you move. They do their business/evil through U-Haul and will damage your stuff when they move it. They will then follow that up by coming back to your property to destroy stuff. In my case, they broke into my car. Uhaul trucks are also terrible and mine overheated and killed my cat. I think its fair to say I hate U Haul.

name: Jon Bernreuter
text:
I have a 1980 Oldsmobile Cutlass, and these guys really suck at this car. Years ago, I told the cashier I had a Cutlass, and he asked me what the make was. I told him, "Dude, it's a Cutlass. It's an Oldsmobile." His response to me was, and I'm dead serious, "Sorry man, cars aren't really my thing.”

Back in February, I needed a new alternator. Super simple, easy to find part, never had any trouble getting one for this car. Round one, the one they sold me was clocked wrong. We tried to clock it ourselves, because my car was immobilized 1hr 30min away and I didn't want drive to the nearest NAPA to return it. Well we took it apart wrong and broke all the wires.

I took it back and explained what happened. They told me they couldn't do a warranty swap because I broke it. Which I'm sure is technically correct, but also a really bad way to handle it since the part they sold me was wrong, and I had the old one when they sold it to me. Two separate cashiers looked at the old one and the new one side by side and sold it to me anyway.

I just bought a new one instead of fighting it for round 2. The guy that sold me the second one accidentally just gave it to me, assuming it was a warranty replacement, AND refunded me on my card, so I actually made money on this transaction. Which is a good thing because this one immediately whined because it had bad bushings straight out of the box.

Round 3, I gave up and gave an auto shop a ton of money to buy one from a specialty shop already clocked and install it for me, because a 15 minute home repair was taking a week.

A week or so, another shop thought they discovered a radiator leak (I later found out the top hose was just loose and spraying coolant, so this is all really ironic). I went back to NAPA and asked for advice. Fatal mistake.
One of the guys, and he's super nice but dumb as a box of rocks when it comes to cars, sold me some Radiator Stop Leak. I also bought some other radiator additive that supposedly helps rejuvenate the o-rings or something. Not sure how that is possible for something that doesn't actually go inside the cylinders, but this guy works at NAPA so I'm sure he's got this.

He tells me I can dump both of them into the radiator and it will be fine. I follow his advice and read the instructions on the bottle. The system had just been flushed and filled, and the radiator and water pump are less than 5 years old. I let the car idle for 15 minutes and run the heater full blast.

I drive the car for 30 seconds and the hot light comes on, and the shift point for first gear has shifted up. I drive it to the shop and the guy immediately tells me I ruined my coolant system, and probably cooked the transmission, because Radiator Stop Leak is garbage and it does damage. They had to take the radiator out and all the hoses off and blow them out by hand, because the system was so clogged up they couldn't even flush it out with the radiator machine. It cost me $371.

So these $20 additives clogged up my cooling system to the tune of $371, and now I need a new transmission to the tune of $3,000. My car is parked because it will be at least 2 years before I can afford to fix it.

Radiator Stop Leak essentially laughed at me on Twitter, and I don't have the receipt anyway, AND NAPA DOES NOT ARCHIVE RECEIPTS. They have computers, but I guess they just don't save them on purpose. I can get an archived receipt from Guitar Center for a windscreen I bought in 2006.

Anyway, these employees are all super nice and they try to be helpful, but do not listen to them because they are all dumb as hell.
